title: India’s Sarvam launches Indus AI chat app as competition heats up
summary: Sarvam's Indus chat app is currently available in beta.

title: The creator economy’s ad revenue problem and India’s AI ambitions
summary: The creator economy is evolving fast, and ad revenue alone isn’t cutting it anymore. YouTubers are launching product lines, acquiring startups, and building actual business empires. In fact, MrBeast’s company bought fintech startup Step, and his chocolate business is outearning his media arm. This isn’t just one creator’s strategy. For many, it’s the new playbook.  On this episode of TechCrunch’s Equity podcast, hosts Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, and Rebecca Bellan unpack how creators are diversifying beyond ads, […]

title: Remember HQ? ‘Quiz Daddy’ Scott Rogowsky is back with TextSavvy, a daily mobile game show
summary: The former HQ host Scott Rogowsky is back with TextSavvy, a live mobile game show that he's building on his own terms.

title: Anthropic-funded group backs candidate attacked by rival AI super PAC
summary: Dueling pro-AI PACs have centered around backing or targeting one New York congressional bid: Alex Bores, whose RAISE Act requires AI developers to disclose safety protocols and report serious system misuse.

title: Apple’s iOS 26.4 arrives in public beta with AI music playlists, video podcasts, and more
summary: Several updates are introduced in iOS 26.4, including an AI-powered playlist-generation feature in Apple Music, support for video content in the Podcasts app, end-to-end encryption (E2EE) for RCS messages, and more.

title: InScope nabs $14.5M to solve the pain of financial reporting
summary: The startup, founded by accountants who worked at Flexport, Miro, Hopin and Thrive Global, automates the difficulties of prepping financial statements.

title: Great news for xAI: Grok is now pretty good at answering questions about Baldur’s Gate
summary: A new report from Business Insider reveals that high-level engineers at xAI were pulled off other projects to make sure Grok could answer detailed questions about the video game Baldur's Gate.

title: Ukrainian man jailed for identity theft that helped North Koreans get jobs at US companies
summary: A Ukrainian man has been sentenced for helping North Koreans gain fraudulent employment at dozens of U.S. companies and funnel that money back to the regime to fund its nuclear weapons program.

title: Tesla loses bid to overturn $243M Autopilot verdict
summary: "The grounds for relief that Tesla relies upon are virtually the same as those Tesla put forth previously during the course of trial."

title: Threads posts can now be shared directly to your Instagram Story without leaving the app
summary: The new Threads feature lets you share your posts — or anyone else's — to your Instagram Story without leaving the Threads app.

title: ‘Toy Story 5’ takes aim at creepy AI toys: ‘I’m always listening’
summary: Addictive, AI-enabled tablets are taking over, and also, Woody is balding in the new Toy Story movie, out June 19.

title: Meta’s metaverse leaves virtual reality
summary: Meta said it's shifting focus for Horizon Worlds to be "almost exclusively mobile" and that it will separate its Quest VR platform from the virtual world.

title: Lucid Motors slashes 12% of its workforce as it seeks profitability
summary: The layoffs affect hundreds of full-time workers in the US, according to an internal memo obtained by TechCrunch.

title: AI’s promise to indie filmmakers: Faster, cheaper, lonelier
summary: AI expands access to filmmaking for resource-constrained creators. But as efficiency becomes the industry’s north star, creativity risks being overwhelmed by a deluge of low-effort, AI-generated content.

title: Prepare for pitch battle: Startup Battlefield 200 nominations are open
summary: Nominations for TechCrunch Startup Battlefield 200 are open. Pitch at Disrupt 2026 in October in front of top VCs and the full TechCrunch audience. Nominate your startup or for one that's deserving.

title: Peak XV raises $1.3B, doubles down on AI as global VC rivalry in India heats up
summary: Peak XV says most of its new capital will target India as the firm prioritizes AI, fintech and cross-border bets while navigating recent partner departures.

title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 Super Early Bird rates end in 1 week
summary: The lowest ticket rates of the year for TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 end next Friday, February 27. Save up to $680 on your pass. Register now before prices increase.

title: Why investors are going gaga over solid-state transformers
summary: The technology promises to replace several parts of the grid with one device that’s both controllable and updatable.

title: OpenAI says 18- to 24-year-olds account for nearly 50% of ChatGPT usage in India
summary: The company said on Friday that users between 18 and 24 years of age account for nearly 50% of all messages sent by Indians to ChatGPT, and users under 30 account for 80% of usage in the country.

title: The OpenAI mafia: 18 startups founded by alumni
summary: Many employees have come and gone since OpenAI first launched a decade ago, and some have launched startups of their own. Among these, some have become top rivals (like Anthropic), while others, just on investor interest alone, have managed to raise billions without even launching a product.

title: Aerial_Knight’s DropShot captures the thrill of skydiving and makes it stylish
summary: I've always wanted to go skydiving. Aerial_Knight's DropShot, from indie developer Aerial_Knight, lets me live out that dream - at least in a safe, virtual kind of way. It also lets me shoot bullets from finger guns, wield laser skulls, and wear cool sunglasses while I'm falling through the air. So maybe it's better than […]

title: Stellantis is in a crisis of its own making
summary: Demand for EVs has gone glacial, and one automaker after another is running aground: General Motors threw $7.6 billion overboard. Ford washed $19.5 billion off its books. Leave it to Stellantis to face the most titanic charge yet, a $26.5 billion bill for its own misplaced bet on EVs. The Jeep, Dodge, and Chrysler parent […]

title: Anker’s X1 Pro shouldn’t exist, but I’m so glad it does
summary: The Soundcore Nebula X1 Pro is too weird to exist. It's so absurd that it feels like a gadget fever dream - and I'm here for it. At the heart […]

title: SCOTUS rules Trump’s tariffs are illegal — but the fight is far from over
